intro: Alloneuron ecuadorense, commonly known as the Ecuadorian alloneuron, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with yellowish-white flowers, which are typically pollinated by insects. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of Andean flora and ecological diversity.
